meanings.definition: To take something quickly and often forcefully
meanings.sent1: She was snatching the toy from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The thief was caught snatching a purse from a passerby.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was snatching all the nuts for itself.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be snatching away the moments of joy.
meanings.sent5: The wind was snatching the leaves from the trees in a playful dance.

meanings.definition: The act of taking something quickly and often forcefully
meanings.sent1: The snatching of the necklace happened in broad daylight.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the snatching made her more cautious in crowded places.
meanings.sent3: The snatching of the last cookie caused a commotion in the room.
meanings.sent4: The snatching of the spotlight by the new singer surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The sudden snatching of the trophy left the team in disbelief.
